wikipedia_page.main:
Edward Newton (31 October 1871 – 9 May 1906) was an English first-class cricketer.
Newton made his first-class debut for Hampshire in the 1900 County Championship against Lancashire. Newton played seventeen first-class matches for the club in the 1900 season, the last of which came against Sussex. In his seventeen first-class matches for the club Newton scored 568 runs at an average of 18.32. Newton made three half centuries, with a high score of 69 against Derbyshire.  	
Newton died in Edinburgh, Midlothian on 9 May 1906.
